intro: Omphalodes luciliae var. cilicica, commonly known as the Cilician bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
